metadata.title: CVE-2014-1693 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Multiple CRLF injection vulnerabilities in the FTP module in Erlang/OTPR15B03 allow context-dependent attackers to inject arbitrary FTP commandsvia CRLF sequences in the (1) user, (2) account, (3) cd, (4) ls, (5) nlist,(6) rename, (7) delete, (8) mkdir, (9) rmdir, (10) recv, (11) recv_bin,(12) recv_chunk_start, (13) send, (14) send_bin, (15) send_chunk_start,(16) append_chunk_start, (17) append, or (18) append_bin command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1693` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

erlang - 1:17.3-dfsg-3ubuntu1
erlang-asn1 - 1:17.3-dfsg-3ubuntu1
erlang-base - 1:17.3-dfsg-3ubuntu1
erlang-base-hipe - 1:17.3-dfsg-3ubuntu1
erlang-common-test - 1:17.3-dfsg-3ubuntu1

criterions.comment: erlang package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:17.3-dfsg-3ubuntu1').
